meanings.definition: A representation of a wave in the form of a graph or diagram.
meanings.sent1: The waveform on the screen showed the sound wave graph.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the waveform to understand the pattern of the wave.
meanings.sent3: The waveform on the chart looked like a rollercoaster ride.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions created a waveform of ups and downs throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The colorful waveform danced across the monitor, mesmerizing the audience.

meanings.definition: The shape or form of a wave.
meanings.sent1: The waveform of the ocean wave was smooth and gentle.
meanings.sent2: Surfers pay attention to the waveform to catch the perfect wave.
meanings.sent3: The waveform of the cloud resembled a fluffy pillow in the sky.
meanings.sent4: His smile had a waveform that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The waveform of her hair cascaded down her back like a waterfall.
